security_audit.summary: This skill is a static markdown knowledge base containing only informational content about email marketing. All static scanner findings are false positives: backticks are markdown code fences (not shell execution), cryptographic algorithm mentions are contextual references (not code), URLs are documentation links (not network exfiltration), and there is no credential access or code execution capability. Safe for publication.

prompt_templates.title: Email Setup Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my current email marketing setup. I'm using [ESP name] for a [industry] business doing [revenue]/year. I have [list flows]. What am I missing?
prompt_templates.scenario: Get a comprehensive audit of existing email marketing

prompt_templates.title: Fix Deliverability Issue
prompt_templates.prompt: My emails are landing in [Gmail promotions / spam / primary] tab and my open rates dropped from [X]% to [Y]% over the last [time period]. What's going on and how do I fix it?
prompt_templates.scenario: Diagnose and fix inbox placement problems

prompt_templates.title: Build Automation Flow
prompt_templates.prompt: Build me a complete [welcome series / abandoned cart / win-back] email sequence for my [business type]. I sell [products]. Average order value is [AOV], repeat purchase cycle is [time].
prompt_templates.scenario: Create automated email flows from scratch

prompt_templates.title: Industry Benchmark Request
prompt_templates.prompt: What are the average open rates, click rates, and conversion rates for [industry]? What automation flows should I prioritize and what revenue per recipient should I target?

output_examples.input: Review my email setup. I'm running Klaviyo for a DTC skincare brand doing $2M/year with a welcome series, abandoned cart, and weekly newsletter. What am I missing?
output_examples.output: Based on your setup, here are the critical gaps: 1) No post-purchase flow (highest ROI automation for DTC) - add 5-7 emails covering shipping, satisfaction, review request, and cross-sell. 2) No win-back flow for 90+ day inactive subscribers - you're likely losing $50-100K annually in unrecaptured revenue. 3) Segmentation is basic - implement RFM scoring to identify VIPs for exclusive offers. 4) No re-engagement flow before sunset - could recover 15-25% of lapsed list. Your welcome series is strong but consider adding a segmentation question in Email 1 to improve targeting.

output_examples.input: Build an abandoned cart sequence for my premium coffee business. Average order is $45, repeat purchase cycle is 30-45 days.
output_examples.output: Here's your 3-email abandoned cart sequence: Email 1 (1-4 hours): Simple reminder - 'You forgot your [product]' with product image, name, and checkout link. No discount. Email 2 (24 hours): Address objections with social proof (reviews), shipping details, and guarantee. Email 3 (48 hours): Small incentive if margins allow - 10% off for first-time abandoners only. Expected performance: 40-50% open rate, 5-10% conversion rate, $3+ revenue per recipient. Priority: Above fold CTA in all emails, mobile-optimized template, plain text version for Gmail promotions tab.

best_practices: Start with the three core flows: welcome series, abandoned cart, and post-purchase before adding secondary automations
Use engagement-based sending - only send campaigns to subscribers who clicked in the last 30-60 days to protect sender reputation
Implement double opt-in for new subscribers to prevent spam traps and improve list quality
anti_patterns: Sending to your entire list without segmentation - this destroys sender reputation and lands emails in spam
Using a single email for both marketing and transactional messages - separate domains are essential for deliverability
Skipping authentication setup (SPF, DKIM, DMARC) before launching - Google/Yahoo require this for bulk senders

faq.question: Does this skill connect directly to my email platform?
faq.answer: No, this is a knowledge base skill that provides strategic guidance. It cannot directly access your ESP, import subscriber data, or send emails. You implement the recommendations manually in your email platform.

faq.question: What email platforms does this cover?
faq.answer: The skill covers Klaviyo, Mailchimp, Kit (ConvertKit), ActiveCampaign, HubSpot, Brevo, beehiiv, Omnisend, SmartrMail, Bento, and Postmark with honest comparisons based on your use case.

faq.question: How current is the data?
faq.answer: The knowledge base was last updated in February 2026 and includes the latest Google/Yahoo authentication requirements, Apple MPP impact, and current industry benchmarks.

faq.question: Can this help with cold email?
faq.answer: Yes, Chapter 13 covers cold email infrastructure, warming schedules, personalisation strategies, and compliance for B2B outreach in the US and UK.

faq.question: Does it cover compliance (GDPR, CAN-SPAM)?
faq.answer: Yes, Chapter 10 covers GDPR, CAN-SPAM, CASL, CCPA, and Australian Spam Act with key rules and penalties for each region.

faq.question: How do I use this with Claude Code?
faq.answer: Install the skill, then talk to Claude like an email marketing consultant. Ask questions, request flow builds, or ask for benchmarks. Claude will pull from the 55,000-word knowledge base to provide specific, actionable advice.
